name: Comparative Race and Ethnic Studies
descriptions: The CRES minor provides an interdisciplinary examination of race, ethnicity, and their intersections with gender, class, sexuality, and nationality in the United States and globally.

All courses must be passed with a grade of C- or better. Maximum of 9 hours may be below the 30000 level. Note: Beginning after June 1, 2026, the Department of Comparative Race & Ethnic Studies will merge into the English department. Faculty, majors, minors, and courses will continue under that umbrella.

courses: 18 hours of CRES-attributed courses from at least three departments
